intro: Adenocarpus bacquei, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds with silky hairs. Adenocarpus bacquei is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils.
